I didn't really understand the hoopla surrounding this show. From the outside it just looked like a show about a bunch of stuffy nobles, but one episode and I was hooked! Great show!
Now I get it...
The Little Mermaid (Two-Disc Diamond Edition: Blu-ray / DVD + Digital Copy)
Jodi Benson  (Actor),     Christopher Daniel Barnes  (Actor),     Ron Clements  (Director, Writer),     John Musker  (Director, Writer)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    G    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Kids & Family
['THE LITTLE MERMAID, one of the most celebrated animated films of all time, is now spectacularly transformed for the first time on Blu-ray, with a state-of-the-art digitally restored picture and brilliant high-definition sound! Venture under the sea where Ariel, a free-spirited mermaid princess, longs to be part of the human world. After bravely striking a bargain with Ursula, a sneaky sea witch, Ariel embarks on the adventure of a lifetime. With Flounder and Sebastian at her side, Ariel will need all of her courage and determination to make things right in both her worlds.']

Bought a few of these for Christmas gifts and one for my own daughter. Looks great and still as fun as it was when I was a kid! Some of the best Disney songs ever in this film.
Who doesn't love The Little Mermaid?
Everyone's Hero
Jake T. Austin  (Actor),     Brian Dennehy  (Actor),     Christopher Reeve  (Director),     Colin Brady  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, Kids & Family, Family Features
['Product Description', "Ten-year-old baseball fanatic Yankee Irving (voiced by newcomer Jake T. Austin) is always the last one picked for sandlot baseball games. But when Babe Ruth's prized bat is stolen during the 1932 World Series, Yankee steps up to the plate to help retrieve it for his beloved idol. He embarks on a wild cross-country journey that teaches him the stuff real heroes are made of, and along the way, Yankee learns the importance of perseverance and the true meaning of friendship.", 'Amazon.com', 'A talking baseball and a talking bat might not be the most likely characters to inspire a personal revelation about perseverance and self-esteem, but in', "Everyone's Hero", 'it\'s just those two things that help young Yankee Irving (Jake T. Austin) overcome his reputation as a baseball loser and become a true American hero. A ten-year old spurned by the neighborhood kids because of his repeated strike-outs at bat, Yankee is at a point of personal crisis. A chance encounter with a talking foul ball named Screwie (Rob Reiner) and some time spent with his father (Mandy Patinkin), who\'s a janitor for the New York Yankees, gives Yankee cause for some serious reflection. When Babe Ruth\'s famous bat "Darlin\'" (Whoopi Goldberg) is stolen by opposing teammate Lefty Maginnis (William H. Macy) and Yankee\'s father is fired as a result of the theft, it suddenly falls to Yankee and his new friend Screwie to find Darlin\' and return her to Babe Ruth before the Chicago Cubs loose the final game of the World Series to the New York Yankees. The combined efforts of Screwie, Darlin\', and new friend Marti Brewster (Raven-Symoné) aid Yankee in conquering his own self-doubt and infuse him with the self-confidence and strength to profoundly affect both his family and the entire baseball world. Produced by Christopher Reeve, this CGI animated presentation features a great cast of characters and voice talent, and an important message about the power of perseverance. (Ages 5 and older) --', 'Tami Horiuchi', 'Beyond', "Everyone's Hero", "Everyone's Hero: The Movie Storybook (Paperback)", 'More Sports-Themed Family Films', 'Nothing is Impossible: Reflections on a New Life', 'by Christopher Reeve', 'Stills from', "Everyone's Hero"]

I'm not sure why this got such bad cinematic reviews. My daughter thinks it's hysterical and she loves watching it with her grandpa, who is an umpire!
Cute little baseball movie

I just started watching this series and am so glad it's on Prime, since I am totally late to discover this one. You care about the characters and what happens to them, all though it does get slow sometimes. There's nothing super earth-shattering in the plot line, but you do appreciate the small details in the conversations and scenarios, especially as a parent.
I shoulda gotten on the bandwagon sooner

Great sophomore season

**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preferences:** The user continues to favor clever and humorous programming suitable for all ages, with an emphasis on family-friendly content. They maintain a passion for classic animated films, which continues to influence their appreciation for timeless storytelling.

- **Viewership Patterns:** Recently, the user has expressed a notable enjoyment of series with evolving character development, indicating a shift towards narratives that deepen over time. Their engagement with sophisticated series reflects a blending of lighthearted interests with more intricate storylines.

- **Emotional Engagement:** The latest interaction reveals a strong appreciation for character growth within familial contexts, underscoring their interest in narratives that showcase emotional depth and relatable family dynamics across seasons.

- **Sentiment Analysis:** The user maintains a positive outlook, valuing quality storytelling that resonates with both children and adults. Their reviews highlight a preference for series with gradual character arcs and impactful music, aligning with their experiences as a parent.

- **Younger Audience Appeal:** While predominantly seeking content for younger viewers, the user is increasingly drawn to series with more mature themes, demonstrating an evolving taste that entertains a broader audience.

Overall, this user exemplifies a nuanced blend of family programming and sophisticated narratives, fostering connections and shared enjoyment while remaining open to exploring new and enriching series.
